qas.question: Who is the creator of American Idol?
What year did American Idol begin airing?
What British show is American Idols format based on?

context: American Idol is an American singing competition series created by <a0_0><a7_0>Simon Fuller<a7_0/><a0_0/> and produced by <a1_0><a5_0><a8_0>19 Entertainment<a8_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>, and is distributed by FremantleMedia North America. It began airing on <a4_0>Fox<a4_0/> on <a9_0>June 11, <a2_0>2002<a9_0/><a2_0/>, as an addition to the Idols format based on the British series <a3_0><a6_0><a10_0>Pop Idol<a10_0/><a6_0/><a3_0/> and has since become one of the most successful shows in the history of American television. The concept of the series is to find new solo recording artists, with the winner being determined by the viewers in America. Winners chosen by viewers through telephone, Internet, and SMS text voting were Kelly Clarkson, Ruben Studdard, Fantasia Barrino, Carrie Underwood, Taylor Hicks, Jordin Sparks, David Cook, Kris Allen, Lee DeWyze, Scotty McCreery, Phillip Phillips, Candice Glover, Caleb Johnson, and Nick Fradiani.
